src:
Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan/Melati Melaju ke Babak Kedua
06 Nov 2019, 13:13 by Danang Sundoro



Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan/Melati Melaju ke Babak Kedua



Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan/Melati Melaju ke Babak Kedua


KBRN, Fuzhou : Indonesia mengamankan satu tiket babak kedua Turnamen Bulutangkis Fuzhou China Open 2019, melalui ganda campuran Praveen Jordan/Melati Daeva Oktavianti di Haixia, Olympic Sports Center, Rabu (6/11/2019) siang.Ganda Campuran Merah Putih Jordan/Melati mampu menundukkan unggulan ketujuh  Jepang, Takuro Hoki/Wakana Nagahara dua game langsung dengan skor 21-17, 21-19 di hari kedua ini. Terpantau saat game kedua, Praveen/Melati unggul jauh 10-4, namun akibat kesalahan-kesalahan sendiri yang dilakukan Praveen/Melati, lawan pun menyamakan kedudukan menjadi 14-14.  “Seperti kita tahu, pemain Jepang itu ulet dan nggak mudah dimatikan. Waktu unggul di poin 10, kami banyak melakukan kesalahan sendiri, dan poinnya tersusul,” ujar Praveen usai laga dalam keterangan tertulis kepada Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Rabu (6/11/2019).“Memang beda di pola main, mereka kan pemain ganda putra dan ganda putri. Tadi kami banyak ambil poin dari bermain pola. Kalau kami adu kuat-kuatan, kan tahu sendiri kalau pemain Jepang nggak gampang ditembus. Jadi kami main di strategi,” tutur Praveen mengenai lawannya hari ini.BACA JUGA : Bulutangkis Fuzhou China Open 2019 : Hafiz/Gloria Terhenti Di Hari Kedua, Dihadang TiongkokGrafik penampilan Praveen/Melati tengah menanjak, mereka baru saja menjuarai turnamen Denmark Open 2019 dan French Open 2019. Di turnamen ini, Praveen/Melati berharap bisa bermain maksimal seperti di dua turnamen sebelumnya, meskipun Melati tidak dalam kondisi fit seratus persen. “Kami pasti kasih permainan terbaik, targetnya main maksimal dulu,” kata Praveen.“Apa pun kondisinya, tidak bisa jadi alasan, yang penting tetap fokus, konsentrasi dan komunikasi terus sama partner. Kalau dijalani semua, di lapangan juga lupa sama kondisi, karena sudah fokus sama pertandingan,” jelas Melati ketika ditanya soal kondisinya,” pungkas Melati.
text:
Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan / Melati Advance to the Second Round
Nov 6 2019, 13:13 by Danang Sundoro



Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan / Melati Advance to the Second Round



Fuzhou China Open 2019, Jordan / Melati Advance to the Second Round


KBRN, Fuzhou: Indonesia secures one ticket in the second round of the Fuzhou China Open 2019 Badminton Tournament, through the mixed doubles Praveen Jordan / Melati Daeva Oktavianti at Haixia, Olympic Sports Center, Wednesday (11/06/2019) afternoon. able to beat the seventh seeded Japan, Takuro Hoki / Wakana Nagahara two straight games with a score of 21-17, 21-19 on this second day. Watched during the second game, Praveen / Melati far superior to 10-4, but due to his own mistakes made Praveen / Melati, the opponent also equalized to 14-14. "As we know, Japanese players are tenacious and not easily killed. When winning at 10 points, we made many mistakes ourselves, and the points were overtaken, "Praveen said after the match in a written statement to Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Wednesday (11/06/2019)." It is different in playing patterns, they are not men's doubles and women's doubles players. We previously took a lot of points from playing patterns. If we compete strongly, we know that Japanese players are not easily penetrated. So we play in strategy, "Praveen said of his opponents today. READ ALSO: Badminton Fuzhou China Open 2019: Hafiz / Gloria Stopped On the Second Day, Blocked by China Open 2019. In this tournament, Praveen / Melati hopes to play a maximum as in the two previous tournaments, even though Melati is not in one hundred percent fit condition. "We will definitely give the best game, the target is to play optimally first," Praveen said. "Whatever the conditions, it cannot be an excuse, the important thing is to stay focused, concentrate and communicate with the partners. If everything is undertaken, the field also forgets the conditions, because it has focused on the match, "explained Melati when asked about her condition," concluded Melati.
